results.title: Encounter Bay
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Shepherd and S A Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Encounter Bay, where the Murray River enters the sea, has a colorful history of whaling stations and ship wrecks. Bleached bones, rusty anchors, and museums remain to testify. Now Victor Harbour, Port Elliot, and Goolwa are popular holiday resorts. Luxurious accomodation, miles of surf beaches, golf courses, and natural beauty have made it a playground for people of all ages.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Shepherd and S A Government Tourist Bureau

results.title: The Coastline
results.creator_credit: Eric Lomas, Victorian Film Corporation and Yarra Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Victoria the Garden State”.
A scenic film which shows the coastline of Victoria, and its wildlife. Without commentary.

results.title: Caulfield: a Living City
results.creator_credit: John Freney-Mills, Ewart Wade, Caulfield City Council and Caulfield Film Society
results.brief_description:
Weekend activities in the City of Caulfield. Schools, churches, sporting and social service groups keep the city alive at weekends. Activities include the running of the Caulfield Cup, and quieter games such as tennis and bowls. School children learn road safety at special classes and attend the Youth Centre. For the elderly citizens there are “meals-on-wheels”.

(11/2/19 CC) Selected highlights list from MP:
00:00:02:00 Title card with Caulfield Town Hall in background
00:00:32:00 Caulfield train station
00:01:07:00 Caulfield Race Course on Caulfield Cup
00:01:54:00 Caulfield marching girls perform with Caulfield Citizen band
00:03:54:00 Packer Reserve Bike Track with St Johns Ambulance attendees
00:04:35:00 Caulfield Park Bowling Club with men playing bowls and women playing croquet at 00:04:56:00
00:05:20:00 Caulfield Central RSL
00:05:50:00 cricket game on H.G Ritchie Oval
00:06:12:00 15th Caulfield Somers Country scouts packing glass bottles into a 1950’s Holden Ute
00:06:40:00 model aeroplane flying with Caulfield Technical College - now Monash University (Caulfield campus) in background
00:07:02:00 City of Caulfield Memorial Youth Centre with basketball being played and wrestling with up and coming star Don Fitzpatrick
00:08:00:00 Women sewing at the Caulfield Memorial Youth Centre
00:08:38:00 Curraweena homes near Caulfield community hall
00:09:55:00 Salvation Army marches past Salvation Army building
00:10:20:00 Church service at St Catharine South Caulfield, 402 Kooyong Rd
00:11:07:00 Salvation Army band play at Nooralie Private Hospital
00:12:24:00 what appears to be St Aloysius Church with spire
00:12:44:00 Caulfield Park Conservatory and gardens
00:14:00:00 garbage collection from house and people leaving for work
00:14:52:00 shot of Caulfield Technical College now Monash University (Caulfield campus) and students entering the front stair case
00:15:05:00 Kilyington Baptist Grammar School
00:15:30:00 Caulfield South Pre-school
00:15:52:00 Elsternwick train station
00:16:08:00 asphalt laying
00:16:28:00 Sir Henry Gullett Memorial Baby Health Centre
00:16:43:00 Elderly Citizen Club and meals service
00:18:27:00 Caulfield Town Hall inside and outside

results.title: Australia's greatest river
results.brief_description: A study of the Murray River and the countryside and towns along its banks. Emphasizes the danger of over stocking, over cropping, and forest fires, and shows how steps are being taken to overcome these.
results.description: A study of the Murray River and the countryside and towns along its banks. Emphasizes the danger of over stocking, over cropping, and forest fires, and shows how steps are being taken to overcome these.

results.title: At the Land's End: the Wilson's Promontory National Park
results.creator_credit: David Swift, Wilson's Promontory Committee of Management, Parks Victoria and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film shows the breathtaking landscape, the wildlife and the facilities for holiday-makers at Tidal River. The work of the ranger is described and there are two outstanding sequences dealing with the Smoking Cliffs at Darby River and gannets diving off Five-Mile Beach. Narrated by Wynn Roberts.
